title: R43869
content: Congress is made up of 541 individuals from various territories and states. Since 1789, 12,179 people have served in Congress, with 669 serving in both chambers. The 114th Congress had 248 Republicans and 192 Democrats in the House, and 54 Republicans, 44 Democrats, and 2 Independents in the Senate. The 114th Congress is composed of 44 Democrats, 2 Independents who caucus with Democrats, and has one of the highest average ages in recent U.S. history. The youngest Representative is Elise Stefanik (R-NY) at 30 years old, while the oldest is John Conyers (D-MI) at 85. The oldest Senator is Dianne Feinstein (D-CA) at 81, and the youngest is Tom Cotton (R-AR) at 37. In the 114th Congress, public service/politics is the dominant profession for Senators and Representatives, followed by law and business. Data from the CQ Roll Call Guide to the New Congress shows the most frequently listed occupations for Members. Additionally, there are 53 Senators with previous House service, 100 Members with education backgrounds, and a few physicians and dentists among the Members. In the 114th Congress, there are various professionals serving as Senators and Representatives, including physicians, dentists, psychologists, optometrists, pharmacists, nurses, ordained ministers, former mayors, state governors, lieutenant governors, judges, prosecutors, former Cabinet Secretary, ambassadors, state legislators, congressional staffers, and congressional pages. In the 114th Congress, there are professionals serving as Senators and Representatives, including physicians, dentists, psychologists, optometrists, pharmacists, nurses, ordained ministers, former mayors, state governors, judges, prosecutors, former Cabinet Secretary, ambassadors, state legislators, congressional staffers, and congressional pages. Additionally, there are various other professionals such as sheriffs, police officers, firefighters, CIA agents, Peace Corps volunteers, physicists, microbiologists, chemists, engineers, public relations professionals, accountants, software company executives, management consultants, car dealership owners, venture capitalists, bankers, real estate industry veterans. In the 114th Congress, there are professionals serving as Senators and Representatives, including physicians, dentists, psychologists, optometrists, pharmacists, nurses, ordained ministers, former mayors, state governors, judges, prosecutors, former Cabinet Secretary, ambassadors, state legislators, congressional staffers, and congressional pages. Additionally, there are various other professionals such as sheriffs, police officers, firefighters, CIA agents, Peace Corps volunteers, physicists, microbiologists, chemists, engineers, public relations professionals, accountants, software company executives, management consultants, car dealership owners, venture capitalists, bankers, real estate industry veterans, construction industry workers, social workers, union representatives, radio talk show hosts, broadcasters, reporters, journalists, insurance agents, stockbrokers, screenwriters, comedians, documentary filmmakers, artists, farmers, ranchers, cattle farm owners, almond orchard owners, vintners, members of the military reserves, and members of the National Guard. In the 114th Congress, there are professionals serving as Senators and Representatives, including physicians, dentists, psychologists, optometrists, pharmacists, nurses, ordained ministers, former mayors, state governors, judges, prosecutors, former Cabinet Secretary, ambassadors, state legislators, congressional staffers, and congressional pages. Other occupations listed in the CQ Roll Call Member Profiles include emergency dispatcher, letter carrier, urban planner, astronaut, flight attendant, electrician, auto worker, museum director, rodeo announcer, carpenter, computer systems analyst, Foreign Service officer, and software engineer. The vast majority of Members hold bachelor's degrees, with many holding educational degrees beyond a bachelor's. 20 Members of the House have no educational degree beyond a high school diploma; eight Members of the House have associate's degrees as their highest degrees; 82 Members of the House and 16 Senators earned a master's degree as their highest degree. In the 114th Congress, a significant number of Members hold advanced degrees, with 36% of the House and 54% of the Senate having law degrees. This marks a shift from previous Congresses where a higher percentage of Members held bachelor's degrees. Additionally, a few Members have doctoral or medical degrees. In the 114th Congress, many Members have advanced degrees, with 36% of the House and 54% of the Senate holding law degrees. Some Members also have doctoral or medical degrees. Additionally, several Members have prestigious scholarships and military backgrounds. In the 114th Congress, a significant number of newly elected "freshmen" Members had limited experience in the House and Senate. Additionally, 98% of Members were affiliated with a specific religion, with the majority being Christian. In the 114th Congress, a significant number of newly elected "freshmen" Members had limited experience in the House and Senate. Additionally, 98% of Members were affiliated with a specific religion, with the majority being Christian. 55% of the Members are Protestant, with Baptist as the most represented denomination, followed by Methodist; 31% are Catholic; 5.2% are Jewish; 3% are Mormon; and other religious affiliations include Buddhist, Muslim, Hindu, Greek Orthodox, Unitarian Universalist, and Christian Science. 20% of the total membership are women, with 88 in the House and 20 in the Senate. In the 114th Congress, there are 48 African American Members, with 46 in the House and 2 in the Senate. Among them, 44 are Democrats and 2 are Republicans. There are also 20 African American women in the House. Additionally, there are 38 Hispanic or Latino Members, with 34 in the House and 4 in the Senate. In the 114th Congress, there are 25 Democratic Members in the House, 9 Republicans, and 9 women. There are four male Hispanic Senators, two Hispanic sisters in the House, and 14 Asian, South Asian, or Pacific Islander Members. Eight of the Asian Pacific American Members are female. Additionally, there are two American Indian Members, both Republicans. In the 114th Congress, there are 13 Representatives and 3 Senators born outside the US, with various birthplaces including Canada, Cuba, and Japan. The Constitution requires Representatives to be citizens for 7 years and Senators for 9 years before taking office. There are 101 Members with military service, with 82 veterans in the House and 20 in the Senate. In the 114th Congress, there are 101 Members with military service, including 82 veterans in the House and 20 in the Senate. The number of veterans in Congress has been steadily declining in recent decades. In the 114th Congress, there are 101 Members with military service, including 82 veterans in the House and 20 in the Senate. For more information on trends in member characteristics since 1945, refer to CRS Report R42365.
